item.title: ğŸ¡Venv with anaconda (use system's python instead...)
item.description:
tl;dr

Use system’s python instead of anaconda’s one when using python3 -m venv to create virtual envs. (or use --without-pip option)

venvã‚’ä½¿ã†ã¨ãã«ã¯Anacondaç’°å¢ƒã®Pythonã ã¨ã‚³ã‚±ã‚‹ã®ã§ã€ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ ã®Pythonã‚’ä½¿ã†ã‹ã€--without-pipã€€ã‚ªãƒ—ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚’ã¤ã‘ã‚‹å¿…è¦ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã€‚

Log

macOS Sierra 10.12.4, Miniconda3

For tiny web app with flask, anaconda seemed overkill. venv is preferable…

tuxedocat@katzenwelt:flaskapp
â¤ python3 -m venv --prompt web ./env
Error: Command '['/Users/tuxedocat/Codes/_sandbox/flaskapp/env/bin/python3', '-Im', 'ensurepip', '--upgrade', '--default-pip']' returned non-zero exit status 1.

noo… --without-pip worked, but manual instllation of pip is needed.

What is that ensurepip?

tuxedocat@katzenwelt:~
â¤ python -m ensurepip
/Users/tuxedocat/miniconda3/bin/python: No module named ensurepip

OK, anaconda’s python cannot work in that way because of this

(deleted lines that adds conda path to $PATH)

Omake

tuxedocat@katzenwelt:~
â¤ cat .config/fish/functions/use_conda.fish
function use_conda --description "Simply add conda path"
  set -x PATH ~/miniconda3/bin $PATH
  source ~/miniconda3/etc/fish/conf.d/conda.fish
end

item.title: Dokuwikiã§æ—¥æœ¬èªPDFã‚’å‡ºåŠ›ã—ãŸã‹ã£ãŸ
item.description:
CentOS6.6, Dokuwiki Hrunã€Dw2Pdf_20150622ã§ã®ã“ã¨ã€‚

ãã®ã¾ã¾ã§ã‚‚ä¸€å¿œæ—¥æœ¬èªã¯å‡ºåŠ›ã•ã‚Œã‚‹ãŒã€ä¸­å›½èªãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ³ãƒˆã ã£ãŸã‚Šã€è±†è…ã«ãªã£ãŸã‚Šã—ãŸã®ã§ã€ã„ã‚ã„ã‚ã‚„ã‚‰ãªãã‚ƒãªã‚‰ãªã‹ã£ãŸã€‚

  • ipagp.ttfç­‰ã‚’dw2pdf/mpdf/ttffonts/ã¸æ ¼ç´
  • dw2pdf/mpdf/config_lang2fonts.php
    • East Asianã®ã¨ã“ã‚ã§ $unifont = "ipagp, sjis, sjisB"
  • dw2pdf/mpdf/lang2fonts.css
    • :lang("ja")ã®ã¨ã“ã‚ã§font-family: ipagp;
  • dw2pdf/conf/style.css
    • body {font-family: ipagp, sans-serif; }
  • dw2pdf/DokuPDF.class.php
    • _constructer
      • $this->useAdobeCJK = true;

item.title: Link: Type hinting support in PyCharm
item.description:
(via Type Hinting in PyCharm)

Eclipse (PyDev) â†’ SublimeText + iPython â†’ Atom + iPython (è‡ªå®…), Spyder, PyCharm, VS2013 (ä¼šç¤¾) â€¦ã¨ã„ã†æ„Ÿã˜ã§è‰²ã€…è©¦ã—ã¦ããŸã‘ã©ã€PyCharmãŒä¸€ç•ªä½¿ã„ã‚„ã™ã„ã¨æ„Ÿã˜ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã€‚

“Type Hinting”ã«ã¤ã„ã¦ã¯è‰²ã€…ãªã‚„ã‚Šæ–¹ãŒææ¡ˆã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¦ã€ã¾ã ã¾ã ç™ºå±•é€”ä¸Šãªã‚“ã ã‘ã©ã€ãã®ä¸­ã§ã¯ã€PyCharmã‚„JediãŒå¯¾å¿œã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹Docstringå½¢å¼ã®æ–¹æ³•ã¯ã€ç¾çŠ¶ã®æŠ˜è¡·æ¡ˆã¨ã—ã¦ã†ã¾ã„ã‚„ã‚Šæ–¹ã‹ã‚‚ã—ã‚Œãªã„ã€‚ (Pythonã®ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ã¨ç‹¬ç«‹ã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã£ã½ã„ã®ã§ã€‚) ãŸã ã€å€‹äººçš„ã«ã¯ã„ã¤ã‚‚Numpyå¼ã®Docstringã‚’çœŸä¼¼ã¦ã„ãŸã®ã§ã€ã¡ã‚‡ã£ã¨é¢å€’ãã•ã„ã€‚

PEP3107 ã‚„ Mypy ã¿ãŸã„ãªé–¢æ•°ã‚¢ãƒãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³æ–¹å¼ã®ã»ã†ãŒè¦‹ãŸç›®ã¯å¥½ãã ã€‚ PyCharmã¯ã“ã¡ã‚‰ã«ã‚‚éƒ¨åˆ†çš„ã«å¯¾å¿œã—ã¦ã„ã‚‹ã¿ãŸã„ãªã®ã§ã€æœ€é«˜ã¨ã—ã‹è¨€ã„æ§˜ãŒãªã„ (?)
